thread.title: Teen arrested for clock attending White House Astronomy Nigh
thread.title_full: Teen arrested for clock attending White House Astronomy Nigh - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Teen arrested for clock attending White House Astronomy Nigh
text:
ASHRAF SHAZLY/AFP/Getty Images Ahmed Mohamed, a 14-year-old Sudanese Muslim teenager from the United States who became an overnight sensation after a Texas teacher mistook his homemade clock for a bomb. The Texas teen who got arrested for bringing a homemade clock to school had stars in his eyes Monday after being invited to the White House’s “Astronomy Night.”
Ahmed Mohamed was grabbed by cops in September when he brought the clock to school and a teacher thought it looked like a bomb and alerted authorities.
KIDS BRING CLOCKS TO SCHOOL TO SUPPORT #ISTANDWITHAHMED
The arrest of the 14-year-old created an international commotion and resulted in an invitation from President Obama, who wanted to see the “cool clock.”
“I felt really happy that I got support from the President,” Ahmed told the Dallas Morning News on Monday . “It’s really amazing that he helped me.”
A White House spokesman said the President thinks Ahmed’s example should inspire more kids to enjoy science, but he wouldn’t be able to meet with him.
BRISTOL PALIN SLAMS OBAMA FOR INVITING CLOCK-MAKING TEEN TO WHITE HOUSE
Ahmed will be able to hang out with NASA scientists and astronauts attending the second annual event.
Police ultimately chose not to charge Ahmed with having a hoax bomb, though he was suspended.
Ahmed told the Dallas newspaper that the homemade clock won’t make the trip to the White House.
With News Wire Services
Related Stories Teen who brought clock to school meets Sudan president Ahmed Mohamed could have been 'head of a gang': teacher Texas family withdraws teen clockmaker from school district
